naoLegs

Class NavigationHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • naoLegs.NavigationHandler

  • public class NavigationHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    NavigationHandler takes care of handling all the requests that have anything to do with leg movements, including turns. The values are received and first scaled (if necessary) to create equal values relative to the robot's size. Afterward the request is executed.
    Author:
    Miguel Arduz

    • Method Detail

      • walkTo

        public void walkTo(float x,
                   float y)
            throws com.aldebaran.qi.CallError,
                   java.lang.InterruptedException
        Handles the walk request by first scaling the given values (if necessary) and then executing the movement in the robot.
        Parameters:
        x - Displacement on the X axis
        y - Displacement on the Y axis
        Throws:
        com.aldebaran.qi.CallError - Triggered if there are problems internally in the robot's library
        java.lang.InterruptedException - Triggered if there are problems internally in the robot's library

      • turnTo

        public void turnTo(float turnTheta)
            throws com.aldebaran.qi.CallError,
                   java.lang.InterruptedException
        Handles the turn requests by just executing the movement command on the robot with the given value. The direction and angle of the turn is defined already on the client side.
        Parameters:
        turnTheta - Angle of turn
        Throws:
        com.aldebaran.qi.CallError - Triggered if there are problems internally in the robot's library
        java.lang.InterruptedException - Triggered if there are problems internally in the robot's library

      • scaleWalkingCoordinates

        private float[] scaleWalkingCoordinates(float x,
                                        float y,
                                        boolean scaleHeight)
        Scales the given displacement values depending on the user's and the robot's height. This is only done if the feature for it is enabled.
        Parameters:
        x - Displacement on the X axis
        y - Displacement on the Y axis
        scaleHeight - True if the values should be scaled
        Returns:
        The scaled displacement values that can directly be applied to the robot
